pros: Small town, patient centered, privately owned, employee's are seen as individuals and they care about each other, with a focus on patients.
cons: Rural, nonprofit = lower wages than big corp.

pros: Benefits are ok, pay is about the same for jobs in area.
cons: Management is one-sided, a "good ole boy system", they do NOT care about the health and welfare of their employees. They skip breaks and sometimes do not provide lunches due to short staffing. The nurses are not skilled to work in high acuity areas and lots of shady shortcuts putting your own license in jeopardy. The most toxic work environment that I have ever worked in. They encourage and advance nurses who are racist and with certain political backgrounds, if you are not in agreeable with them and their lack of morality then they make sure to push you out or get rid of you.

pros: The President/CEO is a great leader.
cons:
Under market salaries
There are a lot of strong personalities and it is all very disorganized.

pros: Great people, co-workers feel like family.
cons: Pay is not equally comparable to other companies. Pay is way too soft for all the hard work that is done.

job_title: Medical Assistant Coordinator in Salem, OR
pros: Family feel, good benefits, competitive pay, flexible hours. Administration really does care about staff. Multiple community based projects that are aimed to help the people.
cons: The job as a whole can be very stressful, and at times it may feel as thought you do not have the power to fix the things that need to be fixed. when I say this I men staffing issues such as getting applicants to apply.
Stressful, constantly short staffed, pay a little lower than averages around the area.

pros: Fair pay, engaging work, great co-workers.
cons: Middle management quality varies wildly by department.

review_title: Good for a start, not much else.
pros: Lots of time off from low patient census. Nice benefits, family costs under $200/month and small copays.
cons: Management is NOT supportive, small hospital, poor charting system, frequent mistakes, lots of new grad RN's without experience and without support, low pay with minimal raises, would not trust this hospital to care for my family. Some nurses are amazingly wonderful, others very much like high school cliques and snobby. Huge turnover, hire and as soon as employees can, they leave. That says something about the company.

pros: Small town feel with big city technology and employees. Everyone tries to have a positive attitude and a small town atmosphere.  Fun to be around and great benefits
cons: Occasional negative employee that tries to drag us down before they move on because they don't mesh with such positive staff

job_title: Office Manager and Medical Coder in Stayton, OR
pros: Small town community hospital with deep roots in the community. Comfortable place to be.
cons: Can’t be too many... a lot of long time employees.

pros: very professional, excellent healthcare, and great work environment.
cons: I can honestly say I really enjoyed working for this facility.
Nurses are unapproachable and rude. No teamwork.
